com.snap2d.world

Class Entity

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.snap2d.world.Entity
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Renderable, Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Ball, GenericEntity, Paddle, PlayerEntity

    public abstract class Entity
extends Object
implements Renderable, Serializable
    Represents an object in the 2-dimensional world space. Entity provides a base implementation for all objects that exist in the world.
    Author:
    Brian Groenke
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Entity

        public Entity(Point2D worldLoc,
      World2D world)
        Creates this Entity at the given world location in the context of the given World2D. The screen bounds are calculated using the World2D, converting the world location to a screen location and setting the size based on pixels-per-unit.
        Parameters:
        worldBounds - the bounding box for the entity in world space
        world - the World2D this Entity exists in; used for converting coordinates and determining world/screen position.

    • Method Detail

      • initBounds

        protected void initBounds(int swidth,
              int sheight)
        Should be called as soon possible (usually in the constructor) by the Entity implementation to initialize screen and world bounds. This method creates the screen bounds rectangle with the current screen location and given dimensions, then creates the world bounds by converting it to a world rectangle.
        Parameters:
        swidth - width of the Entity on screen
        sheight - height of the Entity on screen

      • interpolate

        protected double interpolate(double n,
                 double lastN,
                 float interpolation)

      • getWorldY

      • setScreenLoc

        public void setScreenLoc(int nx,
                int ny)
        Sets the location of this Entity on the screen coordinate system. Supertype implementation simply resets the world/screen points and bounds. Overriding subclasses can call through to super for convenience.
        Parameters:
        newLoc -

      • setWorldLoc

        public void setWorldLoc(double nx,
               double ny)
        Sets the location of this Entity on the world coordinate system. Supertype implementation simply resets the world/screen points and bounds. Overriding subclasses can call through to super for convenience.
        Parameters:
        newLoc -

      • getWorldBounds

        public Rect2D getWorldBounds()
        Returns:
        a Rect2D representing the Entity's bounds in world space.

      • getCompatibleBounds

        public Rectangle2D getCompatibleBounds()
        This method subtracts height from the Y value to compensate for the inverted Y-axis. Bounds returned from this method will function correctly with the built-in Java geometry system.
        Returns:

      • getScreenBounds

        public Rectangle getScreenBounds()

      • isRendering

        public boolean isRendering()

      • collidesWith

        public boolean collidesWith(Entity e)
        Checks to see if this Entity collides with the given Entity. This method uses a low precision bounds-check followed by a high-precision CollisionModel check if the bounds intersect.
        Parameters:
        e -
        Returns:
        true if the Entities are in collision, false otherwise.

      • getCollision

        public Entity.EntityCollision getCollision(Entity e)
        This method uses the same process as collidesWith(Entity) but returns an EntityCollision object that contains the collided Entity and low precision collision box.
        Parameters:
        e -
        Returns:
        the computed intersection box between the two Entities in world space or null if no collision

      • renderWorldSprite

        public static void renderWorldSprite(Graphics2D g,
                     int sx,
                     int sy,
                     BufferedImage img)
        Convenience method provided for drawing the BufferedImage of an Entity in world space. The coordinates are assumed to have been converted from world space, so the image height is subtracted from the Y value to compensate for the change in position representation (World2D Cartesian system recognizes point locations as bottom left - Java2D uses top left).
        Parameters:
        g - graphics object to render on
        sx - x coordinate of the Entity in screen space
        sy - y coordinate of the Entity in screen space (without height subtracted)
        img - the sprite image to draw

      • setAllowRender

        public abstract void setAllowRender(boolean render)
        Set whether or not the Entity should be rendered on screen. The behavior of this method is entirely up to the implementation.
        Parameters:
        render -

      • getPhysics

        public abstract GamePhysics getPhysics()
        Obtain the GamePhysics node of the Entity, if one exists.
        Returns:

      • getCollisionModel

        public abstract CollisionModel getCollisionModel()
        Obtain the collision model of the Entity. This should always return a valid CollisionModel for all Entity implementations. Null values will cause errors in collision and bounds checking.
        Returns:
        the Entity's CollisionModel
